actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase widow's insurance benefits to 100 percent of the insured individual's primary insurance amount, and to provide that such benefits shall be payable at age 50, without actuarial reduction and without regard to disability, in the case of a widow who is otherwise qualified therefor.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Revises title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to increase widow's insurance benefits to 100 percent of the insured individual's primary insurance amount. Provides that such benefits shall be payable at age 50, without actuarial reduction and without regard to disability, in the case of a widow who is otherwise qualified therefor.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase widow's insurance benefits to 100 percent of the insured individual's primary insurance amount, and to provide that such benefits shall be payable at age 50, without actuarial reduction and without regard to disability, in the case of a widow who is otherwise qualified therefor.
